sn5.5:1.2: Then, in the morning, the bhikkhunī Uppalavaṇṇā dressed …
sn5.5:1.3: she stood at the foot of a sal tree in full flower.
sn5.5:1.4: Then Māra the Evil One, desiring to arouse fear, trepidation, and terror in the bhikkhunī Uppalavaṇṇā, desiring to make her fall away from concentration, approached her and addressed her in verse:
sn5.5:2.1: “Having gone to a sal tree with flowering top, bhikkhunī,
sn5.5:2.2: You stand at its foot all alone.
sn5.5:2.3: There is none whose beauty rivals yours:
sn5.5:2.4: Foolish girl, aren’t you afraid of rogues?”
sn5.5:3.1: Then it occurred to the bhikkhunī Uppalavaṇṇā:
sn5.5:3.4: This is Māra the Evil One … desiring to make me fall away from concentration. ”
sn5.5:3.5: Then the bhikkhunī Uppalavaṇṇā, having understood, “This is Māra the Evil One, ” replied to him in verses:
sn5.5:4.2: Just like you might come here,
sn5.5:4.3: I stir not a hair, I feel no terror;
sn5.5:4.4: Even alone, Māra, I don’t fear you.
sn5.5:5.2: Or I can enter inside your belly.
sn5.5:5.3: I can stand between your eyebrows
sn5.5:5.4: Yet you won’t catch a glimpse of me.
sn5.5:6.1: “I am the master of my mind,
sn5.5:6.2: The bases of power are well developed;
sn5.5:6.3: I am freed from all bondage,
sn5.5:6.4: Therefore I don’t fear you, friend. ”
sn5.5:7.1: Then Māra the Evil One, realizing, “The bhikkhunī Uppalavaṇṇā knows me, ” sad and disappointed, disappeared right there.
